metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0503 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.6.27 and earlier and 5.7.9 allows remote authenticated users to affect availability via vectors related to DML, a different vulnerability than CVE-2016-0504.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0503` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

percona-xtradb-cluster-server - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
percona-xtradb-cluster-server-5.6 - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
percona-xtradb-cluster-source-5.6 - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
